title: 113_hr1002
content: The Act titled "Fair Access to Credit Scores Act of 2013" mandates the inclusion of credit scores in free annual disclosures. The Fair Credit Reporting Act is amended to require consumer reporting agencies to disclose a current credit score along with the consumer's file information upon request. The Fair Credit Reporting Act now requires consumer reporting agencies to provide consumers with their credit scores and other relevant information upon request, including details on where their credit score falls within a range and factors contributing to it. Upon request, a consumer reporting agency must provide a consumer with their credit score or risk score. The credit score is a numerical value used to predict credit behaviors like default. Consumer reporting agencies must maintain credit scores or risk scores for consumers for at least 1 year from the date of generation. Consumer reporting agencies are required to provide a credit score without charge to consumers requesting it in connection with a free annual disclosure. Amendments to the Fair Credit Reporting Act include the inclusion of free or low-cost credit reports.
